pycordia.models.channel module¶

class pycordia.models.channel.Channel(client, data: dict)¶

Bases: object

Channel model to mirror a Discord Channel

Operations:

  • str(x): Returns the channel name following a #

  • x == y: Checks if two channels are the same

Embed fields

Type

add_field(name: str, value: str, inline: bool = True)¶

dd a field object to the embed fields

Parameters

  • name (str) – The name of the embed field

  • value (str) – The contents/value of the field

  • inline (bool) – Indicates whether the field is placed either inline or in a new row. True by default

set_author(*, name: str, url: str, icon_url: str, proxy_url: Optional[str] = None)¶

Set the author of an embed.

Parameters

  • name (str) – The name of the author

  • url (str) – An URL related to the author

  • icon_url (str) – An icon URL for the author

  • proxy_url (str) – A proxy URL for the author

set_footer(*, text: str, icon_url: str, proxy_url: Optional[str] = None)¶

Set embed footer.

Parameters

  • text (str) – The text for the footer

  • icon_url (str) – An URL for the footer

  • proxy_url (str) – An alternative URL for the footer

Set embed image.

Parameters

  • url (str) – The URL for the image

  • proxy_url (str) – An alternative URL for the image

  • height (int) – The height of the image

  • width (int) – The width of the image

Set the provider of the embed.

Parameters

  • name (str) – The name of the provider

  • url (str) – The URL of the provider

Parameters

  • proxy_url (str) – An alternative URL for the thumbnail

  • height (int) – The height of the thumbnail

  • width (int) – The width of the thumbnail

pycordia.models.guild module¶

class pycordia.models.guild.Member(data: dict)¶

Bases: object

Model to represent Discord guild user

user¶

The pycordia.models.user.User instance of the member

Type

User

nick¶

Nickname of the user. Can be None if no nickname has been set

Type

str

roles¶

User’s roles, as a list of pycordia.models.guild.Role objects

Type

List[Role]

joined_at¶

An ISO8601 timestamp of when the user joined

Type

str

premium_since¶

An ISO8601 timestamp of when the user started boosting the server

Type

str

deaf¶

Whether the user has been deafened in a voice channel

Type

bool

mute¶

Whether the user has been muted in a voice channel

Type

bool

pending¶

Whether the user has not yet passed the guild’s membership requirements

Type

bool

permissions¶

total permissions of the member in the channel, including overwrites

Type

string

Operations:

  • x == y: Checks if two channels are the same.

  • str(x): Return username with discriminator

class pycordia.models.guild.Role(data: dict)¶

Bases: object

Model to represent a guild’s role.

role_id¶

ID of role

Type

str

role_name¶

Name of role

Type

str

color¶

Role color

Type

int

colour¶

Role colour

Type

int

hoist¶

Whether the role is hoisted

Type

bool

position¶

Role position in the hierarchy

Type

int

permissions¶

Permissions granted to the role

Type

str

managed¶

Whether the role is a managed role

Type

bool

mentionable¶

Whether users can mention the role

Type

bool

Operations:

  • x == y: Checks if two roles are the same

  • x > y: Checks if role x is higher up than role y

  • x < y: Checks if role y is higher up than role x

class pycordia.models.user.User(json)¶

Bases: object

Model to mirror a Discord User

user_id¶

ID of the user

Type

str

username¶

Username

Type

str

discriminator¶

User’s discriminator - a # followed by 4 numbers

Type

str

avatar_hash¶

User’s avatar hash

Type

str

bot¶

Whether the user is a bot or not

Type

bool

system¶

Whether the user is an official Discord System User

Type

bool

mfa_enabled¶

Whether the user has 2FA enabled

Type

bool

banner¶

User’s banner hash

Type

str

accent_color¶

User’s banner color, in hex, encoded as an int

Type

int

locale¶

User’s chosen language

Type

str

verified¶

Whether the user’s email has been verified. Can only be accessed from the email scope, in OAuth2 applications

Type

bool

email¶

User’s email. Can only be accessed from the email scope, in OAuth2 applications

Type

str

flags¶

Flags on user’s account

Type

int

premium_type¶

Nitro subscription type: 0 - None, 1 - Classic, 2 - Nitro

Type

int

public_flags¶

Public flags on a user’s account

Type

int

Operations:

  • str(x): Returns the username + discriminator

  • x == y: Checks if two users are the same

property avatar_url: str¶

Get the avatar url of a user

property mention: str¶

Mention a user

async classmethod user_from_id(client, user_id: str, use_cache: bool = True)¶

Get user info, given the user id

Parameters

  • client (Client) – pycordia.client.Client object to use while fetching

  • user_id (str) – ID of the user to fetch

  • use_cache (bool) – Whether to check in cache first, or not

Returns: A pycordia.models.user.User object if the user is found, else None
